result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Goik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling,   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment if required.  Maintain employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $880.00 plus surcharges Joint & Severally.
*   Pay $400 in extradition costs.
May not have contact with victims or co-defts, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; credit for 15 days served if revoked; restitution ordered in the amount of $880.00 (by stipulation of deft), pay $400 extradition costs (by stipulation of deft); bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.  No contact with the victims or co-deft's.

Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/22/17 at 9am.  Bond continued.
